Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: nolamagnola
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a short getaway and found it a delightful home for the weekend. It's close to everything, including the large Montparnasse metro station which means you're never far from anything! You can see the Eiffel Tower from just outside of the hotel. This sighting lead me to a 45 minute walk to visit the tower in person. The walk from the hotel to the tower was full of interesting sites and it really didn't feel like a long walk at all. Free wifi, comfortable enough bedding and a flat screen tv make this modest hotel a great landing spot for your visit to Paris! 5th floor locations with balconcies are the best in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Location is better than anything else?..”
Reviews.Author: MrTBeirut
Reviews.Content: In the middle of everywhere and everything , the metro station is just on the entrance of the hotel, staff r helpfull , nice and smiling, rooms v small as most of similar hotels , breakfast is poor and always missing bread or cheese....rooms r not sound isolated..I could here my neighbors making love loud and clear...at 2 in the morning. ;) but would suggest for tourism where u leave early morning and get back late night..

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location; Tiny Rooms and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: BlahBlah10708
Reviews.Content: Great, helpful, friendly staff, 5 star rated. But the double room was extremely small, and I paid 185 Euros per night. It is a great location with plenty of restaurants and easy access to a major Metro hub. But it was very noisy with the cafes outside. Think of the location as Herald Square and Times Square but without the porno type businesses. The room was clean and the bathroom very modern, but tiny. I was fine with it, but thought that I could have gotten a better value with a better room. I would stay here again but have to think I could get a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: azdemocrat
Reviews.Content: Well, I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. First, the location, right on Montparnasse Blvd so there is a limitless choice of eateries right outside the door. And if you turn left out the door and walk aways down the street, there will be a nice view of the Eiffel Tower. There is also a shopping mall across the street. A metro stop is also right outside the door as well, so beware of foot traffic. The room is small as to be expected, but clean and cozy, with free WiFi. The bathroom is the real surprise as it is quite large for a room that is small. The room I stayed in had a shower and tub. There is ample room for toiletries to be put out either in the sink area or on a wall shelf. The bed was comfortable with rather soft linens and extra pillows. The only negatives and they are minor: need better lighting in the bathroom as it’s only in the sink area rather than overhead. The tub wall is high, so short people like me, have to be careful getting out of the tub. I wouldn’t have minded a small coffee pot in the room either. I like a cup of coffee as I’m getting ready. I had a room up high on the 5th floor and toward the back so most of the noise was not evident. But you can still hear the metro rumblings. I bring earplugs when I travel, so this was not a problem. So ask for a back room if you can. I usually put on the fan in the room if not the a/c for “white” noise, but that was not working as the hotel switched to heat, which I didn’t use. So I just cracked my window a bit for fresh air. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Recap: good hotel, great location, good value for the money in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “small French hotel with a great staff..”
Reviews.Author: bruce w
Reviews.Content: great location subway entrance and bus stop just out the front door. clean comfortable rooms. Very helpful and friendly hotel staff. The hotel is easily accessed from both airports by bus service. Shopping mall across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: travjud
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very convenient and lively location. Metro and buses are right out front. Rooms are small but functional. We got a deal on it so for the price we paid it was great. I would recommend it if you can get a good deal on it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain, Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: TodoElMundo71
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading all previous reviews. Great deal on hotel website for about $130 USD per night. We were prepared for the small rooms, which is typical of Paris hotels (unless you're spending $500+/night to stay at the Ritz). Stayed with a girl friend, we had a twin room. It was very clean and had a great view of Blvd Montparnasse, with a small balcony (room 55 is one of 4 rooms with balconies). Room was very quite when we shut the French doors, noisy when doors were open and we did NOT notice the train. Bathroom was gorgeous and quite large for the room size. Best thing about this hotel is the location-you are in the middle of the action and it's a short walk to the Latin Quarter, etc. We took the Air France bus from CDG for 16.50 euros which drops you off at Gare Montparnasse. If you have a lot of luggage the short walk to the hotel can feel like quite a hike. We took a taxi from hotel back to CDG for 50 euro, it was worth it for 2 people. We stupidly ignored the previous reviews about the overpriced breakfast and got it the first morning--it was a joke, definitely not worth it. Cafes on either side of front step of hotel serve much better breakfast for much cheaper. Hotel staff was outstanding, all of them. The supposedly cranky black guy written about in previous reviews was very nice to us on a consistent basis. Staff went above and beyond to help us locate things like laundromat & health club, both of which were right around corner (printed out maps and schedules for us). The elevator was small but not that small. My friend and I are both big boned 5'9" and we fit in it just fine, went up one at a time the first time when we each had 2 large suitcases. Stayed 5 nights and will definitely stay here again when I return to Paris, this was the 5th hotel I've stayed at in Paris and stands out as being a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, no noyse”
Reviews.Author: hmendonca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just left the hotel and we strongly recommend it. We stayed for 4 days and the location is perfect, close to the gare Montparnasse, if you are travelling by train, close to rue de rennes, that has lots of very good stores, including markets with good bread cheese and wine. The only issue is the small double bed and small room. One more good point is that when we needed help, we had, they were very nice offering maps and information.

Reviews.Title: “Honesty and service”
Reviews.Author: serenity_healing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of April on a spontaneous trip after the death of my mother. I needed some R&R. The room was cute but small and could have done with a refurb but the bathroom was excellent. We requested a room at the back of the hotel as the concourse outside was noisy with traffic and this was changed with a smile on arrival. We looked over attractive rooftops and it was indeed tranquil and we slept well. Good beds. In the rush to leave I left my little box of jewellery in the room by mistake. When I got home and found I'd lost it I was upset as it contained items of great sentimental value. I phoned the hotel and they found it, returned it in an SAE and charged a modest amount on my credit card for the stamps. They were so obliging and helpful and senstive and I was immensely relieved to have my precious aide-memoirs returned to me, quickly, efficiently and with courtesy. For this I shall be forever in their debt and would recommend them heartily. Also, although noisy, the hotel is right next to the Montparnasse Bienvenue train station, near to the trendy St Germain quarter and very convenient for most of the sights of Paris. They even let us watch the Royal Wedding on their lobby TV (despite France being a republic!) when the cleaner turfed us out of our room to clean it. A personal service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “The best part of this hotel is the location”
Reviews.Author: Deborahdp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights. By Paris standards the room and bed are average. Our room had a beautiful view of the intersection and cafes outside, but since the noise was loud we couldn't keep the window open for long and the air conditioner didn't work at all. The room got very hot at night. We had a superior level room. The free internet in the lobby didn't work all week but their was no problem with the paid internet in the rooms. I agree with the previous poster, staff are friendly and helpful except for the older black guy that is there in the evening, very unhelpful and rude. Guests seemed like a bother. The positives, there are nice cafes on each side of the front door that offers breakfast for 1/2 the hotel cost with free wifi. There is a subway stop right outside the door. Lots of shops and restaurants in the immediate area, including a train station and Air France busses that take you right to your terminal if you are traveling. I would stay here again if the price was right but I just wouldn't expect more than adequate accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “So overpriced I could cry!”
Reviews.Author: lfranchesca
Reviews.Content: We stopped two evenings and after being initially relieved that the staff all spoke much better Englsh than either of us spoke French (although we did try), we were on the whole disappointed with our stay. The room we booked was 255 euros per night and 25 euros for breakfast but, we were early and paid a suppliment to have a "superior" room (40 euros per night) which was ready while our booked room was not. I don't know what made the room "superior" as the bed was only a double (and very uncomfortable); the room was small and although clean and the bathroom small and clean, for 295 euros per night, I expected more for my money especially since the night after, we stopped at the Kempinski in Bruges which was cheaper (just) but far, far bigger, more comfortable and generally a better accommodation. Also, although we did not use the mini bar, we did notice the extortionate prices: 8 euros for a small tub of sweets, 6 euros for a small bottle of water, 6 euros for a can of coke etc and wireless internet was 24 euros per day!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: elnino67
Reviews.Content: Room is very small. Bed is very small (length 1.90 m) and uncomfortable. Lot of noise from the street and the subway. Excellent location though - walking distance from the city center. Lots of shops, bars and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise! Clean, adorable, and tres francais!”
Reviews.Author: ammotion
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed on the 6th floor of this hotel. We'd spent months planning and researching our hotel for our trip, and then got moved to Edouard VI after a pipe burst in the place we'd originally booked. Based on the reviews we read, we were really stressed, but our stay could not have been any more pleasant! Our room was very small, but very clean with comfortable beds and excellent storage. The closets and shelving were thoughtfully laid out, and made it easy for us to put all of our American sized luggage in to our French sized room. The bathroom was newly renovated, equipped with nice bright towels and soaps. Everything was spotless! Great waterpressure! Cool summer nights had us sleeping with the windows open and we weren't bothered at all by the street noise. The front desk man said the rooms facing the back of the hotel entrance were quieter, which was consistent with our experience. The price was great for the room, but I'd skip the breakfast. It's pricey, and there are great bakeries nearby at which to grab a little something. Be sure to be adventurous and at least TRY to communicate in French at the hotel and surrounding establishments. You'll be rewarded for your efforts! This hotel was only a few steps to the metro, and just across the street from several bus line stops. We were thrilled with our stay!! One note: The elevator is absolutely tiny. I'm 5'4 and 120 pounds and could barely get in with my roller suitcase (medium size). Be forewarned! :) This hotel is close to a lot of great shopping at Rue de Rennes, nearby. Several good restaurant options, too! Also, a beautiful neighborhood cathedral very nearby, and a short walk to Luxembourg Gardens. This is so conveniently located to a lot of things on foot, and even more via metro or bus! I hope to stay here again next summer on our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and service in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Fimby
Reviews.Content: Have just had 4 night stay in Paris at the Hotel-Edouard VI in Montparnasse. Staff could not have been more friendly, rooms were cleaned thoroughly, and the showers had real power! Very helpful when I lost my camera (Found in the beautiful Jardins des Luxenbourg). Good base for sightseeing as the walk up to the Seine gives the opportunity to explore St Germain de Pres and the Latin Quarter and you soon find your way around. The Metro is literally on your doorstep and very quick to get to the Eiffel Tower or The Louvre etc. Thoroughly recommended! Thomas family - England

Reviews.Title: “Renovation starting July 2009”
Reviews.Author: thkl070
Reviews.Content: Location is very close to metro station (Montparnasse Bienvenue). Hotel will be renovated starting July 2009, hotel is very tired. Rooms are small but clean. There is a lot of noise coming from the street into the rooms. I would rate this as a 2* hotel, maybe the renovation will make it a 3* again.

Reviews.Title: “Had to leave--odiferous rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BelleJour
Reviews.Content: The night concierge was extremely helpful, courteous and a pleasure to deal with. The two rooms that I was shown however, were so odiferous---one with urine and the other with food smells from the restaurant below--that I had to leave. It is hard for me to believe that other reviewers and I are speaking of the same hotel. The location is great and if they upgrade all their rooms (these were on the lower room levels), the hotel would get my vote. I caution anyone to preview their room before taking it and stand in it for at least 5 minutes to let the masking cleaning fluid smell dissipate some---take some sniffs and then decide if you will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't tell anyone about this place!”
Reviews.Author: tominseattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights, March 12 through 19, 2009. What a great place. Truly, the staff of this hotel is the friendliest, most helpful and delightful. Catherine and Madame FÃ©lix went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and just plain fun. The hotel is situated on a very busy intersection, but the place is very well sound proofed and we were not bothered in the least by traffic noise. There is a Metro entrance twenty-five feet from the front door and a the Montparnasse â€” BienvenÃ¼e station, a major rail-bus-metro hub, is a five minute walk. You can get to anyplace in metropolitan Paris in twenty minutes. Good, inexpensive food is all around the place. Bottom line: great value, great location and the best staff. Don't tell anyone about this place. Please!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: venice-michele
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edouard VI last May and we loved it. The size of our room was too small: I ordered flowers to surprise my wife and they put them on a chair in front of the entrance door of our room! Anyway, the location is fine and we loved the wonderful steak house located just in front of the hotel. I must say thank you to the receptionist who suggested us and booked a table at 'Procope' a very romantic and historic restaurant not far from the hotel. We had a drink the last night up to the Monparnasse tower: then, I strongly recommend to have a dinner up there: really fantastic views, real piano soft sound when you enter.. candle lights. Ca c'est Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Our First Time in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: WillAtkinson
Reviews.Content: ...and it won't be our last! This was an amazing trip, and the Edouard VI is in a great location. There are bistros and patisseries nearby, and the Metro is literally steps from the front door. The hotel itself is a little shabby, but the staff was great and the room was clean and comfortable. We did not go to Paris to lounge around the hotel, and neither should you. This is a great location, the Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler and the Invalides are less than a 30 minute walk from the hotel. There is great shopping along the street, and directly across is a mall with a number of shops. While most of the people we encountered spoke English, don't be shy about trying out your guidebook French. I did and was treated wonderfully because of my efforts. I highly recommend the Edouard IV. Bon voyage.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, small rooms, needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveller41
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in October ,on the second floor, at the front of the hotel. Our first impressions were not good. The lift was tiny only room for 2 people without much luggage and the hallways are best described as dark, narrow and shabby with worn carpeting. Our room was very small (no more than 10 x 13 ft excluding on-suite), there's very little storage space, so don't bring more than 1 suitcase. The room was clean and linen was changed daily. However, the furnishings are dated and soft furnishings (carpets and quilt) badly need replacement - French design and taste weren't evident. . However, the bed and pillows were comfortable and a flat screen TV (with CNN and BBC news) added a modern touch. The room contained a small minbar, but no tea making facility, the bathroom was modern and clean. . Breakfast (at 10 euro each) was basic but adequate, (coffee, tea, milk, OJ, fruit salad, a basket full of baguettes, croissants, cereal, cheese and ham) and is served in the cellar / basement. Most hotel staff spoke English and were helpful! The hotel is excellently located for sightseeing with most major sights withing walking distance and there are plenty of surrounding restaurants, bars and cafes. The Montparnasse Bienvenue metro station is located right outside the hotel, unlike other reviewers we didn't experiance any noise in the hotel from the metro, however we had to keep windows closed at night to exclude noise from the road below. Overall ,well located small hotel which needs upgrading to maintain its 3 stars. We have stayed in better priced / equiped paris hotels and while we would consider staying here again, we would probably look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: needs2go
Reviews.Content: Pleasant front desk staff. Small hotel, small rooms. Room needed a thorough cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “For Parisian standards it's OK.”
Reviews.Author: georgia_phoebe
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Paris for the first time keep in mind that it's extremely hard to find a spacious and nice hotel room on a budget. I was satisfied with Edouard VI, although it was definitely not worth the 130 euros I was paying per night. But for Parisian standards it was OK. The room was small with very basic furniture (a small desk and an armchair), without much storage room, but very clean and the bathroom all new and sparkling. Our towels and linen were changed every day. In terms of decoration nothing special, but nothing too kitschy or horrible. There was a flat screen television (small) and a mini bar. The room was very quiet, but we had no view whatsoever, our window oversaw just rooftops. Which was not so bad either. Being on the 5th floor we weren't really bothered by the metro which other reviewers had mentioned. The staff was nice enough - as we were low maintenance guests, I can't say much on the issue. They were polite and friendly though. The location is pretty sweet. It's very close to St Germain and Luxembourg park, close to Les Invalides area (a posh quartier with many good restaurants and home to the Musee Rodin, and Musee Maillol which are both amazing). The area is full of restaurants and cafes, some of which stay open later than most Parisian establishments. The 15th arr. which lies below Luxemburg is very charming. A real slice of bourgeois Paris, without tourists and pretension. The metro station is really convenient and links you to many metro lines, while the bus coverage is also good. In general, the hotel covered our needs and in any case, when in Paris you have no reason to stay in your hotel room other than sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “"Hear the heart beat of the city"!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryandPete
Reviews.Content: The hotel sounded charming from the reviews. What a disappointment to discover such a pokey little room on the second floor.The room seemed beautifully quiet as it was situated at the back of the hotel (uninspiring view} until .....yes, you guessed correctly, at some ungodly hour of the morning the metro shuddered into life and the whole second floor seemed to vibrate in protest! And this at very regular intervals! When we inspected the bathroom facilities on arrival all seemed suitably modern, but here again we were in for a nasty surprise,(No one told us to bring the flippers and snorkel!}The use of the shower was accompanied by serious puddles of water escaping onto the floor! The wash basin also seemed to lack a washer somewhere or otther as everytime we turned on a tap, water leaked from a joint. Having said all this, the room was clean and the staff helpful. The location was A1. If you are asking us would we stay here again...............I think you can guess the answer to that yourself.

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced dull, noisy, and old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christo_JP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ed. VI 3 nights. Overall I found it an unpleasant stay. Most other hotels were full and I was in a hurry to book somewhere. It's an old building with little charm. I found the hotel staff more defensive than helpful. I booked through their internet site, which was apparently outsourced, because when I was at the front desk to make a change to my reservation, they didn' want to deal with my request unless I made the change through their internet booking system. They told me to pay 5 euros to access their internet to do so. Of course the location itself isn't so bad. My room was clean. The corridors and the elevator need refurbishment. There's a lot of traffic noise from the big crossing opposite the hotel, and I confirm the other reviews about the metro shaking the building every few minutes. I won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Why not refurbish the hallways since you can't move the metro!!”
Reviews.Author: SuzannahMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading previous reviews on Trip Advisor and looking on hotel's website. Totally refurbished hotel should mean exactly that. Hallways are in dreadfully tattered condition. Yes, the metro rumbles beneath you and you can both hear and feel it. Breakfast room was rather like having a table set up in the London underground (tube) - with the train rumbling in the next tunnel - claustrophic - but the staff down in the "dungeon" were pleasant - basic breakfast. The front desk staff couldn't be more helpful, friendly and welcoming. Position of the hotel is excellent - but first impression when you manage to get out of the lift to go to your room is dismay - as you are greeted with really run down hallways, plaster off walls and the look of a very tatty and uncared for hotel. Room was clean but scuff marks on the walls. Bathroom was tiny but surprisingly good quality. Had to possess excellent sense of humour throughout stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but you can feel the Metro in your bones”
Reviews.Author: travelling_couple_7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Paris where we stayed at the Edourd VI hotel. We chose it based on the reviews we read here in Tripadvisor. The staff was very friendly, the elevator a little bit frightening but works, the rooms small but have all you need, the bathroom a nice one for our room, breakfast is OK, but... you can hear every time the Metro passes down under (we where in the 5th floor). Every time it went by we could feel it in our room which was trembling. I think it is important that light sleepers be aware that they might have a problem here. We had it..

Reviews.Title: “This hotel could do with a makeover.”
Reviews.Author: trillieduke
Reviews.Content: The hallways are quite shabby, with chunks of plaster out of the walls. Lots of scuff marks everywhere. But our room was a reasonable size, clean and quiet (we were in a room at the back and as the hotel is in a very busy location, the front rooms may not be quiet). The bathroom door appeared to have come from a demolished building...chipped, different colour paint and didn't fit the door opening! The electrical outlet for shavers didn't work. There were black marks on the light coloured carpet that didn't appear to have been attemped to have been cleaned, The wall mirror had a chunk of glass broken off at the corner and the bath towels were threadbare. The male assistants at the front desk were very helpful and friendly and speak good English (there are also a couple of women but we had no reason to deal with them). The optional breakfast costs 10 Euros and is very basic. The hotel is located slap bang in the main, very busy, intersection of Montparnasse. The Metro is right outside. There are restaurants of all varieties close by and a shopping centre across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Edouard VI Nice Find”
Reviews.Author: Noleman86
Reviews.Content: Hotel and Staff were a delight. Stayed for 7 nights and Hotel was comfortable, clean and the location near Cafes, a Starbucks, Movie houses and the Metro were a plus. Tons of restaurants were in the area. Stayed on the 6th floor facing the street and the room was very quiet with windows closed. The Elevator, though small ran quickly and was nice to have after an exhausting day. Individually controlled AC was a plus in August and ran quietly. Also the mini fridge was a welcome addition after stocking from the nearby grocery. Got a good rate from hotel's Website and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edouard VI - A Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: RobLibertyOnThePark
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris June 20th to the 29th, 2007. It was my first time and after lots of research and reviews on Trip Advisor I selected the Hotel Edouard VI which is in the 6th district called Montparnasse. The location was excellent. The metro was literally in front of the hotel. Montparnasse Train Station was just up the street within a six minute walk and so many buses pass through Montparnasse Square that transportation was easy and readily available to go anywhere in Paris. Catherine at the front desk was most helpful with all of my many questions. She works most days and chances are if you call, you'll get her. She's a treasure! Tell her Rob from Room 41 sends regards! The Hotel's phone number is [--]. Their website is [--] I had read about the small rooms in Paris hotels so I was prepared. I stayed in Room 41 which is in the back of the hotel. No special views, but it was quiet and pleasant. The room rate was 156 euros or about $210 per night. I was travelling by myself with just a carry-on so I didn't have much luggage. The room was great for me. For two people with two large suitcases, it will probably be tight. The room was well-appointed with a very large, modern bath with shower! I had called prior to arrival and talked with Catherine about making sure my room would have a shower. There was a refrigerator stocked with drinks. I didn't bother with their drinks, but this was a nice place to keep a bottle of water. There was a modern computer screen for the television. Most of the stations were in French, except for the BBC and CNN. I didn't watch much tv, but it was nice to have for the weather reports. The room had air conditioning with very easy controls! The hotel had a lift! I was on the 4th floor and after a long day of sightseeing, it was wonderful to take the lift upstairs! I did not sign-up for their morning breakfast as it was too much fun eating at the cafes. There was a public computer available in the lobby at rates competitive to the Internet cafes. I did not experience any hassles or inconvenience at this hotel. I don't believe my experience was unusual. The Hotel Edouard VI is a clean, well-run hotel and I would definitely stay there again. I give it a very high recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fieldmills
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, the staff were nice, room was comfortable and cleaned every day. the hotel itself was in a good location with lots of nice cafes and restuarants nearby, the metro was handy and we used this alot. only a short walk from Jardin des luxembourg and its lovely there, we ate our lunch there a few days and the birds actually take the bread from your fingers, but some times they get a bit over friendly and you have to watch the rest of your sandwich! would definately stay at this hotel again, and recommend it to others. love Paris, this was my third trip and my boyfriends first, we will both be going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: KDavidsonColorado
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in room 47 which faced the courtyard. It was a VERY quiet room and the beds were comfortable. We barely heard street traffic. Front desk service always kind. I had read previous reviews and brought our own shower curtain with an expandable line dry/suction cup thingy and it worked great. Be sure to explore the neighborhood - lots of cafes and shopping nearby. Being at the Montparnasse metro, which is just out the door of the hotel, helped immensely getting around the city. There's a grocery store 2 doors down (Monop) and all the cafes were fun to explore and very nearby! Do the metro Carte l'Orange if you are going to be there Monday-Sunday. Would stay there again if in that neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: nygirl3
Reviews.Content: All one could want for the price- large room (we were on the top floor), convenient location, near a Metro line and major rail station, safe, comfortable, etc. It was convenient to be able to use the computer downstairs, and the staff were very helpful. Our room was a good size and clean, and had a TV and phone (neither of which we used). The bathroom was reasonably modern. Breakfast was good; it was included with our travel package and very convenient, but I'm not sure I would have paid 10 euro for it. And, yeah, not at all in the Latin Quarter-maybe TripAdvisor can consider changing their title?

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem”
Reviews.Author: travelerpowers
Reviews.Content: I only have good things to say about this place. We stayed for four days and the service was great, the location was excellent and steps from the train (although not anywhere near the Latin Quarter as advertised in some places) and the room was decent size, clean, modern with a nice flat screen LCD TV, plenty of channels and a great view. The only complaint I have is that the shower was almost unusable because of the shower head not being secured and the shower doors being too short - water sprayed everywhere and onto the floor. But other than that, I HIGHLY recommend this place and would absolutely stay there again. I got a great rate of 72 euros a night - just search around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value!”
Reviews.Author: GLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: I only relied on Tripadvisor.com to find my hotel in Paris & Barcelona. These reviews really helped out! This little boutique hotel is located at a great location. The hotel is very small including the lobby, elevator (2 people max or 1 person + luggage), room, and bathroom. I already knew this before I stepped foot in our hotel through other peoples comments. The negatives: headboard in room smelled musky and you can smell others smoking if there are any guests smoking on the same floor (i used a towel to stop the smoke from creeping in through the doorway). The positives: GREAT location right next to the metro: Montparnasse Bienvenue (lines 12, 4, 6, 13), breakfast was good (coffee, tea, milk, OJ, fruit salad, a basket full of baguettes, croissant, chocolate croissant, cereal), staff spoke English and was very nice and helpful! Next time I go and if I was on a budget like I was on this trip, I wouldn't mind staying here again just because it was close to many things. I did request a higher floor level so we stayed on the top floor and with a room facing inward (I was afraid the traffic nice would be too loud). I hardly heard the metro line beneath us but that was because we were on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kilkennymadman
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good for a tourist who plans on seeing all the main attractions in Paris. There is a metro & train station right in front of the door, so it is a good base point. The staff of the hotel have good English and are helpful. There are a lot of places to eat close by and a bar next door that has a happy hour from 6 to 8 (very charming bar) On the downside, the rooms are small, there is noise from the metro / train (not too bad), internet access cost â‚¬5 per hour and is only valid for 24 hours. Generally I was happy with the hotel as I used it for a base point to travel all around Paris. I booked the hotel on ebookers.ie for about â‚¬100 per night including breakfast. The hotel staff quoted â‚¬145 a night without breakfast. Breakfast is an additional â‚¬10 per day and is definitely not worth paying extra for.

HotelInfo.Name: Edouard VI Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 61 Boulevard du Montparnasse, 75006 Paris, France
